text_en: 3 Does the person have psychosis? Does the person have at least two of the following: – Delusions, fixed false beliefs not shared by others in the person’s culture – Hallucinations, hearing voices or seeing things that are not there – Disorganized speech and/or behaviour, e.g. incoherent/irrelevant speech such as mumbling or laughing to self, strange appearance, signs of self-neglect or appearing unkempt Suspect Consider consultation with specialist to review other possible causes of PSYCHOSIS psychosis.
